title: Mental Health - Pirisig, John Nash and Lila
description: I just watched the movie "A Beautiful Mind" and couldn't help but notice some stark similarities between Nash and Pirsig. Also, poor Lila didn't have the insight they did. Psychological pathology/health is ripe for exploration in both Pirsig's books.

transcript_parts.text: hi there this is a brief reflection on
something that's on my mind and and so
last night I watched the movie A
Beautiful Mind about the mathematician
John Nash and his schizophrenic
breakdown at the age of 30 and what's

it you know very within a few years of

long course of what was hospitalization

and very strong antipsychotics which is
what they had back then and they both
deal with it ultimately in a very
similar way which means that Nash with
with Elvis wife our compassion for him
and his own desire to maintain his

wife to deal with the voices on their

Pearson does a very similar thing he
tells the people at the mental
institution what they want to hear he
gets out he preserves fetus who
ultimately is the narrator of Lila which
means that that that's the direction

that is the that the few dresses who he
feels like he is to a large extent and
so what's interesting is how these

Nobel Prize after the fact but he was

very grateful for but it also reminds me

her meds are inside of there and feed
hrus who knows what this is all about

patterns are oppressive they
they consist with layers of judgment of

more oh I hope that made sense and I'll
see you next time
